question: Choose the correct preposition: "The cat is sleeping ___ the bed."
In the sentence "We're going to the park," "the" is a preposition.
Fill in the blank: "The movie starts ___ 7 PM."
Which preposition best completes the sentence: "The book is ___ the table."
"During" is a preposition of time.
The cat is hiding ____ the table.
She is interested ____ learning new languages.
They walked ____ the bridge. (across/in)
He is afraid ____ spiders. (with/of)
We will meet ____ the coffee shop. (at/on)
Which preposition best completes the sentence: "She's allergic ___ peanuts."
Fill in the blank: "The store is closed ___ Sundays." (in/on)
Choose the correct preposition: "She's been working here ___ 2010."
In the phrase "afraid of spiders," "of" is a preposition.
Fill in the blank: "The book was written ___ Stephen King." (from/by)
Which preposition best completes the sentence: "We're having dinner ___ 7 PM."
Prepositions "Across" and "through" have the same meaning.
Which preposition best completes the sentence: "The cat is sitting ___ the two chairs."
In the phrase "a friend of mine," "mine" is a preposition.
In the sentence "He sat beside me," the preposition is "beside."
The correct preposition in "She is married with a doctor" is "with."
The correct preposition in "They arrived at the airport" is "at."
She is keen ____ photography. (in/on)
The keys are ____ the drawer. (in/at)
The meeting is scheduled ____ next week.
